pair.Prompt: In Central Transportation Co. v. Pullman Palace Car Co., what did Mr. Justice Jackson say about municipal corporations possessing and exercising powers?
pair.Response: Response: In Grand Rapid &c. Power Co. v. Grand Rapid &c. Co., Mr. Justice Jackson said that municipal corporations possess and can exercise only such powers as are 'granted in express words, or those necessarily or fairly implied, in or incident to the powers expressly conferred, or those essential to the declared objects and purposes of the corporation, not simply convenient, but indispensable.
